properties.areaDesc: Martin, KY; Mingo, WV; Pike, KY
properties.headline: Flood Warning issued February 6 at 9:39PM EST until February 7 at 8:39PM EST by NWS Charleston WV
properties.description:
...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in
Kentucky...West Virginia...

Tug Fork River At Williamson affecting Pike, Mingo and Martin
Counties.

For the Tug Fork River...Minor flooding is forecast.

The Flood Warning continues for
the Tug Fork River At Williamson.
* Until Friday evening.
* At 9:00 PM EST Thursday the stage was 29.9 feet.
* Flood stage is 27.0 feet.
* Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast.
* Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending
at 9:00 PM EST Thursday was 29.9 feet.
* Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 31.9 feet
just after midnight tonight. It will then fall below flood stage
tomorrow morning.
* Impact...At 32.0 feet, Business section on Third Avenue at Harvey
Street begins to flood.
* Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 32.0
feet on 03/30/1975.
properties.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood
deaths occur in vehicles.

Please report Severe Weather to the National Weather Service by
calling toll free, 800 401 9535, when you can do so safely. You may
also report severe weather by posting your report to the Charleston
West Virginia National Weather Service Facebook Page, or by using
the Twitter Hashtag, NWSRLX.

Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/rlx.

The next statement will be issued Friday morning at 945 AM EST.

NWSheadline: The Flood Warning remains in effect
